name: San Diego County COVID-19 Update – 6-30-2021
description: Here is this week’s COVID-19 update from the County Health and Human Services Agency with data through June 29.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Here is this week’s COVID-19 update from the County Health and Human Services Agency with data through June 29.
Vaccination Progress:

Doses administered: Nearly 4.34 million.
Received at least one shot: Almost 2.19 million or 78.1% of San Diegans 12 and older.
Fully vaccinated: Close to 1.87 million or 66.7%.
The goal: vaccinate 75% of San Diego County residents 12 and older or 2,101,936 people, with at least one dose.
To date, 104.1% of the goal population has received at least one vaccine and 88.9% are fully vaccinated.
More vaccination information can be found coronavirus-sd.com/vaccine.

Deaths:

Three new deaths were reported between June 23 and June 29. The region’s total is 3,780.
Three women, all with underlying medical conditions, died between June 22 and June 23.
Of the people who died, two were 80 years or older and one was in their 50s.

Cases, Case Rate and Testing:

84 COVID-19 cases were reported to the County on June 29. The region’s total is now 282,582.
San Diego County’s case rate is 2.1 cases per 100,000 residents as of June 29.
7,107 tests were reported to the County on June 29, and the percentage of new positive cases was 1.2%.
The 14-day rolling percentage of positive cases among tests is 1.1%.

Community Setting Outbreaks:

Six new community outbreaks were confirmed in the past seven days (June 23 and June 29): one in a business setting, one in a faith-based agency setting, one in a hotel/resort/spa setting, one in a restaurant/bar setting, one in a retail setting, and one in a TK-12th grade school setting.
The community outbreaks trigger is more than seven in a 7-day period.

More Information:
Effective immediately, there will no longer be a daily data update on the County’s coronavirus-sd.com website. Data will be updated around 5 p.m. on Wednesdays.
